newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka closes weaker on dlr demand.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka closes weaker on dlr demand.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed weaker at 42.8375/8475 to the dollar in interbank trading on Tuesday compared with the previous close at 42.8250/8450, dealers said.
The local unit opened at Monday's level but slipped later amid steady buying of dollars by some major players.
"Cheap call money drew fresh demand (of dollar). Also import related requirements have suddenly surged," said one dealer.
The call money was traded at previous level at 5.0 to 5.5 percent, dealers said.
